text: For patients with type 2 diabetes and HbA1c > 7.0%, metformin should be initiated as first-line therapy unless contraindicated.
When systolic blood pressure >= 140 mmHg in adult patients, ACE inhibitor therapy should be initiated unless contraindicated.
For patients with acute coronary syndrome and elevated troponin, dual antiplatelet therapy must be initiated immediately.
If a patient with sepsis has lactate > 4.0 mmol/L, broad-spectrum antibiotics should be administered within 1 hour.
When LDL cholesterol > 190 mg/dL, high-intensity statin therapy is recommended for cardiovascular risk reduction.
